attributes.action: Make Parental agreements a legal requirement for unmarried couples (optional for those married) and make such agreements legally binding for the benefit of the child whether parents are together or not.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Children need the best start in life but sometimes parents can argue or separate due to relationship differences and at times of stress.
A legally binding Parental agreement would protect the interests of the child and help parents to reach a concise, mutual agreement regarding the up-bringing of the child early on in their life. Both parents would be recognised as contributing equally to a childs upbringing and would be given equal rights and responsibilities. A legally binding Parental agreement would set out in detail all matters regarding finance, access, residency, care, etc (much like a contract) and would reduce the burden on the Courts in dealing with disputes.
